fields.description:
Background:
Create new space and add permissions to it programmatically. Give SpacePermission both user and group information.

Problem:
Only user permission is effective even space admin page shows that both permissions are in place and valid. When you try to access space you just created with user that belongs to group you gave permissions, you get permission denied message.

Replication:
1) Create programmatically a space, space admin (creator), user group and user that belongs to this user group
2) add space permissions:
    SpacePermission permission = new SpacePermission(SpacePermission.VIEWSPACE_PERMISSION, space, spaceUserGroup, spaceAdminUser);
    space.addPermission(permission);
    spacePermissionManager.savePermission(permission);
3) As a admin user check space permissions from space admin page. Everything seems to be just fine.
4) Try to access space with user that you created in step #1. You get permission denied message.

Notes:
If you create SpacePermission with both user and group information methods isGroupPermission and isUserPermission both return true. Implementation seems to favor if-else if -structures and this way group permissions doesn't get used at all. Could you put atleast a warning to API documentation?
fields.summary: SpacePermissions with group and user information don't work

fields.description:
Background:
We implemented XMLRPC-plugin for Portal-Confluence integration. We use admin level user to access this plugin. One task of this plugin is to fetch recently updated pages within a given space that given user has access to.

Problem:
SmartListManager.getListQueryResults doesn't use given user to restrict search results. User permissions only restrict results at space level.

Consequence:
End users see pages that that they don't have permissions to.

Replication:
1) Create a space, space admin (creator), user group and user that belongs to this user group
2) Add two pages and restrict ones view access to only space admin
3) As a admin level user execute next ListQuery:
    ListQuery query = new ListQuery();
    query.addSpace(space); // space you just created
    query.addType(Page.CONTENT_TYPE); // fetch just pages
    query.addStatus(ListQuery.LATEST_VERSIONS);
    query.setMaxResults(maxResults);
    query.setSortBy(ListQuery.SORT_BY_TIME_MODIFIED);
    query.setUser(user); // user that belongs to user group
    List result = smartListManager.getListQueryResults(query, true); // this list contains both Pages you just created
    // i.e. permissionManager.hasPermission(user, Permission.VIEW, page) returns false
fields.summary: SmartListManager.getListQueryResults results can contain Pages that given user don't have permissions to view

fields.description:
Possibly as a symptom of CONF-14120 we have seen a case where draft objects in the query cache get outdated.  The instance in which it occurred is a high load cluster running 2.6 but with patches for increased hibernate throughput. The individual queries for drafts are done on good indexes, so they probably shouldn't be cached anyway.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15325].
  {panel}

On Apr 24, 2009, at 2:13 PM, Glenn Butcher wrote:

Are we doing anything about windows 7 federated search? Windows 7 allows searching multiple data sources (such as share point or your intranet), so making sure we produce a plugin/whatever to allow searching confluence looks like a good idea.

Windows 7 rc1 is due out May 5th.

http://www.redmondpie.com/search-connectors-for-windows-7-federated-search/

Better info (but requires silverlight):
http://channel9.msdn.com/posts/Dan/Windows-7-Find-and-Organize-Part-1-The-User-Experience/
http://channel9.msdn.com/posts/Dan/Windows-7-Find-and-Organize-Part-2-Building-Federated-Search-applications/

-- 
Glenn Butcher
IT Manager, Atlassian
http://www.atlassian.com
gbutcher@atlassian.com
fields.summary: Consider adding Windows7 search connector for confluence

fields.description:
Create a page in a space, e.g.

Home > Parent1 > page-title

Now create a new page with a different parent in the same space, e.g.:

Home > Parent2 > page-title

On saving this second page, it is unsuccessful as the page title already exists in the space, which is fine. However, the breadcrumbs are altered to show the location of the existing page, even though the user is still on the edit screen for the new page content. This seems odd.
fields.summary: Breadcrumbs should not be changed when user tries to savea duplicate page name

From [blitz test|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/2009-04-16+-+Confluence+-+3.0-m8+-+PDF+Export+Blitz+Test]:

Export a space to PDF (or HTML or XML).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15280].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

The current interactions for selecting macros in the macro browser are inconsistent with the interactions planned for implementation in 3.1. To maintain consistent and expected behaviours with the dialogs in Confluence, we either need to change it now for 3.0, or later for 3.1. Luckily it's a small predominantly visual fix.

h3. Solution

- Remove the grey hover effect.
- Turn the titles and pictures of the macros into clickable links.
- Give the title an underline on hover.
- When hovering over the titles and pictures, the mouse cursor should be a hand. Otherwise, it should be the standard arrow cursor.
- Interactions should be the same just limited to a smaller area - clicking on either the title or picture should take you to the next step.

If that's unclear, please feel free to ask me some questions.
fields.summary: Change Macro Browser list styling

fields.description: In some cases you need to call com.atlassian.plugin.PluginAccessor.getEnabledModuleDescriptorsByClass(Class<D>) very frequently to get an uptodate list of module descriptors. In that cases it makes sense to cache that list as it's very unlikely to change a lot while Confluence is running. It only changes when you enable/disable plugin modules, so the cache needs to listen to those events and update itself accordingly.

If you are watching a space, it appears that no notifications are sent out whenever you move a page in the space you are watching into another space. 

To reproduce:
* Setup 2 spaces, lets call them A and B
* Watch space A and create a page in it
* login as another user and move the page in space A to space B.
* No email notifications are received. In order to get the notification, it looks like you have to be watching space B as well or watching the page itself.

In the static mode, when displaying non-wrapping long custom fields such as "Free Text Field(unlimited text)" in the jiraissues macro, the column extends to the maximum length of one of the values within this column, pushing the rest of the columns to the right and out of the screen's scope. Scrolling to the right will display the rest of the columns. 
Wrapping the text in such large columns in the output of a jiraissues macro will help resolve it.

Current workaround is to avoid including such long fields into the jiraissues macro output.

Tested on Jira 4.0 and Confluence 3.1.1

fields.description:
Update [ADVMACROS-177|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/ADVMACROS-177] when changing this ticket.

*Updated Description*
This bug crashes the JVM itself. You'll notice that there is no Java process running on your system.

*Steps to Replicate*
Add an excerpt-include macro inside the excerpt macro, then do the same on the destination page, creating an infinite loop.

*Workaround*
The workaround is to disable the excerpt and excerpt-include macros. This can be done from {{Administration >> Plugins >> Advanced Macros}}, where you can enable or disable individual modules within a plugin.

Alternatively, you may wish to keep the macro enabled, in which case you may be subject to a user invoking the macro incorrectly, bringing down the system. In these cases you can find the culprit page with the following procedure:

# Run this SQL on the database:
{code}
SELECT * FROM content WHERE CONTENTID IN (SELECT CONTENTID FROM BODYCONTENT WHERE CONTENTID in (SELECT entity_id from os_propertyentry where entity_key='confluence.excerpt') and BODY LIKE '%excerpt-include%')
{code}
# From the resulting content IDs, [edit the page URLs|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Editing+or+Deleting+a+Page+That+Won't+Render]. 

*Solution*
This bug is scheduled for a fix in Confluence 3.2.

*Original Description*:
Circular references for ExcerptIncludeMacro {excerpt-include} aren't checked. Thus {{StackOverflows}} can be produced.

For example create the following 3 pages:
# {excerpt}D{excerpt-include:E|nopanel=true}{excerpt}
# {excerpt}E{excerpt-include:F|nopanel=true}{excerpt}
# {excerpt}F{excerpt-include:D|nopanel=true}{excerpt}

fields.description:
Hello
I have a problem with upgrading Confluence from version 2.9.2 to version 2.10.3.
I was following your manual :
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Upgrading+Confluence+Standalone+Edition
but I have still same error:

HTTP Status 404 - /confluence/login.action

type Status report

message /confluence/login.action

description The requested resource (/confluence/login.action) is not available.
Apache Tomcat/5.5.9

can confluence v. 2.10.3 run in Apache Tomcat version 5.5.9?? 
or I have to change it to new version of tomcat??

when I did it last time then i "just" following the upgrade doc and everything was fine, no idea what the h...  happened now.

I used 7-ZIP - last version for unpack installation, then I update confluence-init.propeties with correct path (checked it many times) 
then I copy both /lib directory and atlassian-user.xml and also  osuser.xml.

and then I start edit service with new path to confluence but I have same error :(

Can you please help me with this problem? 
I think it is problem somewhere between chair and keyboard but I am not able to find where.

Kind regards
Martin
fields.summary: upgrade from 2.9.2 to 2.10.3

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15245].
  {panel}

Using the _IncludePageMacro_ (\{include}) it is possible to create circular references of pages, which are detected by Confluence.

Let _A -> B -> C -> D -> A -> B -> C -> D -> A -> B -> C -> D -> ..._ a link sequence. You can easily see that *D -> A* causes a circular reference.

Confluence somehow handles the scenario above and would output content of  A, B, C, D, *A* followed by an _error_ (displaying page A).

In my opinion this should be improved => output content should be A, B, C, D followed by an _error_ (displaying page A).
fields.summary: Handling of circular references

fields.description:
If a Confluence instance has just gone over its license limit, and someone creates a new page, everything goes fine until it's time to save.  Then Confluence blows up with a license error:

This Confluence installation is not licensed for additional users
You have exceeded the maximum number of users for your license. You will still be able to view content, but in order to create or edit content, you must reduce the number of active users in the installation.

And.. *loses all the page content* the user just added.

This has to be the worst possible way of handling the situation.  Can we not warn users somehow when they _start_ creating new content that it can't be saved?  If not, can we at least somehow preserve the content and display it on the error page (in a textarea for cut&pasting)?

Quotes from users:

bq. The most frustrating part is that everything I put in was just lost and I have to recreate the last hr of work notes!

and

bq. Additionally, it would be nice to display this error before hitting the save button to prevent loss of data entered as I've just lost the data I spent the last 15 minutes authoring.
fields.summary: Going over license user limit causes users to lose data when creating/editing content

fields.description:
I have created a Perl script that uses the Confluence Remote API from the Confluence.pm Perl module. See:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Perl+XML-RPC+client

The purpose of the script is to create a report based upon a Jira issue and other information relevant to that issue. The report is stored in a new wiki page. The script uses the storePage method.

The script is executed in response to a person entering a Jira issue number into a field on a different wiki page. That page uses the run and html macros to execute the script with the input provided by the user.

I have observed that, on occasion, a person does something which causes the script to run twice with the same input parameter. It is possible that the person could have pressed return after entering the issue number, as well as clicked on the "Run" button. These actions result in two instances of the script being run, and causes Confluence to create two identically named pages. I have confirmed that two instances of the script were run by looking in our apache log file.
fields.summary: Remote API method storePage Creating Multiple Pages with the Same Name

fields.description:
After upgrading to 2.10.x some pages may not render correctly, and will throw an error similar to this:

{quote}
Cause

javax.servlet.ServletException: Servlet execution threw an exception
at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:313)

caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/atlassian/confluence/renderer/WikiStyleRenderer
at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethods0(Native Method)

caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.atlassian.confluence.renderer.WikiStyleRenderer
at java.lang.ClassLoader.findClass(ClassLoader.java:359)
{quote}

It appears that the upgrade does not remove the older version of the Page Tree plugin, this can be confirmed by checking the list of installed plugins:

{quote}
- Page Tree (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.pagetree, Version: 1.10.1)
- Page Tree (bnpparibas.confluence.pagetree, Version: 1.3)
{quote}

Removing the older version of the Page Tree plugin will resolve the errors.
fields.summary: Older version of Page Tree plugin not removed during upgrade to 2.10.x
ftp link URLs should be allowed to contain '^'
Add the 'about me' field to the Personal Space sidebar

fields.description:
We have a space with 100k pages in the trash. When we tried to empty it, the operation didn't finish within 3 _hours_ and we had to restart our 
Confluence because users were not able to make operations that required db writes. The errors in the logs indicated that the transaction that was
 opened by the purging operation was blocking other transactions.
\\
\\

fields.description:
Exception observed:
[hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate] execute Unsuccessful: create index l_contentid_idx on LINKS (CONTENTID)
[hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate] execute ORA-01408: such column list already indexed

This causes the upgrade process to fail on the spot.
The process should either accept this as a kind of success and move on, or remove and re-create the index just to make sure.
fields.summary: Upgrade task fails with Oracle when trying to create an index that already exists

fields.description:
Update the profile macro to change the link on the full name to go to the user's profile page (not their personal space).
If we do this we need a way to get from the profile page to the personal space easily (maybe add a calculated field to the field list).
fields.summary: Update user name  in Profile Macro to link to Profile page

fields.description:
In RTE:
1. Place cursor at the beginning of a macro start tag (before '{') or the end of the macro end tag (after '}')
2. Type text

fields.description:
One of our users tried to change the space logo and uploaded a large picture (pic A). Confluence was able to upload this and changed the logo to it. He then tried to change the logo to another picture (pic B) after seeing the size, he was able to browse to pic B to upload it, click on upload and Confluence reported everything being ok, however it hadn't actually uploaded the new picture, just changed the logo back to pic A.

We changed the space logo back to the default (clicking on 'Reset Logo to Default') and uploaded pic B again, Confluence reported everything as being ok but had again changed the logo to pic A.

We double checked that the new picture we were trying to load was definitely different (it was), basically whatever picture we tried to upload Confluence would just revert to the original picture uploaded.

We were able to change the logo by logging on to Confluence from another machine. 

Have you seen this before?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15172].
  {panel}

I followed these guidelines, but this is not fine grained enough.
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Global+Permissions+Overview#GlobalPermissionsOverview-confluenceadmin

We need to prevent space admin adding new permission to their space.
We prefer to manage space permission by the confluence-adminitrators

The reason is that users (including space admins) are not aware of all the users that have access to confluence.
As an example, the RH users will see only RH space, so they (wrongly) beleive that confluence is for RH only and when someone does not have access to their space, they add the 'confluence-users' group with at least 'view' permissions.

We first try to train/limit the number of people, but after 6 months, this was such a mess that we decided to remove all space admin permission.
Currentlyn confluence-administrators (ie IT) are under pressure because they need to:
- communicate about who has which permission
- do all the other space admin (layout, unrestrict a page).

Therefore, I would like to have the 'admin' permission split into 2 permissions:
- 'admin' except edit permission
- edit space admin permissions
The users with 'edit space admin' permissions would be the only ones entitled to add new users/groups in the permission form.

fields.description:
From JDK 1.5 this class is inluded in the JDK, so there is no need to ship that class anymore with Confluence. The real problem here is that you can configure certain app servers like WebLogic to prefer loading classes from the web application, which is a good thing, but leads to the app server loading other classes in the javax.xml.namespace package using the app server class loader and only the QName class using the web app class loader. This gives you a LinkageError because the app server class loader doesn't allow classes for that package to be loaded from a different class loader.

The class is namely in two JAR files:

* stax-api-1.0.1.jar (can be replace by [stax-api-1.0-2.jar|http://download.java.net/maven/1/javax.xml.stream/jars/])
* axis-jaxrpc-<version>.jar (could probably be replaced with [geronimo-spec-jaxrpc-1.1-rc4.jar|http://www.ibiblio.org/maven/geronimo-spec/jars/], but it is missing javax.xml.messaging.Endpoint and javax.xml.messaging.URLEndpoint)
fields.summary: Confluence ships with a javax.xml.namespace.QName class

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15160].
  {panel}

For large confluence installation it is important to have RemoteAPI access to Confluence, but at the same time, it is not desirable to give the remote access to everyone and everywhere. For this reason a new permission that would control access to the remote API is needed. 

It is unimaginable to have Confluence admins of big instances decide who should get the remote api access and for which space. Such a decision should be delegated to the space admins, which are the content owners for the given space and can make a qualified decision about the access via the RemoteAPI for their space.

For this reason a new space permission is needed. This space permission would be controlled as any other permission via the Space Admin -> Permissions view.

A patch with this functionality was developed against Confluence 2.x and the patch provided is rebased for 2.10.2. Patch was written in a minimalistic way in order to introduce minimal performance penalty and make it easy to port it between different confluence versions.

In our case we wanted to restrict access to global remote api calls only to confluence admins as well, so we created a patch for that too (attached as remote-api-admin-authorization.patch). It would be nice if this patch was rewritten so that an individual global permission to access these global methods exists too, but this isn't as important for us as having the space permission patch accepted to the confluence source base. I'm attaching both patches just to give you an idea of what we do. It's up to you if you decide to take the admin patch and rewrite it so that a global permission exists as well.

The order in which patches should be applied to confluence source base is {{remote-api-admin-authorization.patch}} -> {{remote-api-authorization.patch}}.
fields.summary: Remote API Access Space Permission (PATCH)
RemoteAPI Authentication and Custom Authenticators Improvements (PATCH)

I would like to reopen bugs CONF-6240 and CONF-7231. I am having similar problems but it is not an issue of the default view of five items. I created new labels as well as added items to existing labels and the content by label macro is not pulling them in. I have attached image files (png) to illustrate my point. 

I have confluence 2.10.2, I am using firefox 3.0.8, 

Attachments:
